cyclone.name: JOSE
cyclone.current_location: about 415 mi ESE of the northern Leeward Islands
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest, then forecast to turn northwest passing just northeast of the Leeward Islands and north of the Greater Antilles
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or east of the northeastern Leeward Islands (Antigua–Barbuda area)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northeastern Leeward Islands from Guadeloupe northward to Anguilla; possible effects for the Virgin Islands and northern Puerto Rico as the system passes northeast of the area
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm–force winds (34–40 kt) are possible late Saturday night through Sunday with a peak 8 % onset probability and 17 % cumulative chance; hurricane-force winds are not expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible, enough to cause minor flooding on the island.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents likely to develop along north- and east-facing beaches.
